Auth Service¶

class authservice.models.User(*args, **kwargs)¶

Merger of AbstractUser/User from django.contrib.auth.models. Due to requiring email as the username, and some other modifications to the user class.

class Role¶
The role of the user, one of:
  • Role.PATIENT
  • Role.DOCTOR
  • Role.PHARMACIST
counter()¶

Returns the next count. Represented as a 64 bit unsigned integer.

delete_token(session_token, level)¶

Validates a token and deletes. :todo: Throw exception if token invalid?

generate_token(level, exp=datetime.timedelta(0, 1800))¶

Generate a session token for the user, providing the level and exp.

Parameters:
  • level (int) – The token level
  • exp (datetime.timedelta) – The expiration delta of the token
Returns:

JWT encoded claims
Return type:

str
Example: 
>>> user = User.objects.create(...)
>>> token = user.generate_token(level=0)
class authservice.models.ValidTokens(id, jti, exp, user)¶
authservice.models.generate_secret()¶

Generate a cryptographically secure secret.

authservice.models.generate_uuid()¶

Generate a random UUID

Todo

Make the delete_token, create_token, and validate_token functions clearer to use and harder to stuff up using.

Example Usage¶

10
11
12
>>> from authservice.models import User
>>> user = User.objects.create_user(
    username=None,
    email="username@example.com",
    password="password123")
<User: User(uuid=1d7f28a3-8cdf-4aa0-9060-0ad303831aae, email=...

>>> token = user.generate_token(level=0)
b'eyJ0...'

>>> user.validate_token(token) == True
True
